Hyatt Ziva Cancún: Complete Resort Guide

Points-Friendly Family Luxury in the Hotel Zone

Last updated: January 2025

Hyatt Ziva Cancún combines two things families love: reliable Hyatt quality and World of Hyatt points earning/redemption. Located at the tip of the Hotel Zone with views of both lagoon and ocean, the resort offers one of Cancún's best locations plus a dolphin habitat on property. For Hyatt loyalists, it's one of the few luxury all-inclusives where points actually work well. For everyone else, it's simply a well-run family resort in a premium location.

In This Guide

  • Overview & Vibe
  • Accommodations
  • World of Hyatt Integration
  • Dining
  • Dolphin Discovery
  • Kids & Family Programs

  • Booking Tips

Overview & Vibe

{<strong>Hyatt Quality + All-Inclusive:</strong></p><p>Hyatt Ziva brings hotel chain reliability to the all-inclusive world. You know what you're getting: consistent quality, professional service, and a property that actually honors its loyalty program.</p><p><strong>Key Stats:</strong></p><ul><li>547 suites</p><ul><li>Hotel Zone location (Punta Cancún)</p><ul><li>6 restaurants</p><ul><li>5 pools (including swim-up bar)</p><ul><li>Dolphin Discovery on property</p><ul><li>KidZ Club (ages 4-12)</p><ul><li>World of Hyatt participating</p><p><strong>The Vibe:</strong></p><ul><li>Polished and professional</p><ul><li>Family-friendly throughout</p><ul><li>Hotel Zone energy nearby</p><ul><li>Multiple pool scenes</p><ul><li>Modern and well-maintained</p><p><strong>Location Advantage:</strong> Punta Cancún (the tip of the "7") offers:</p><ul><li>Both ocean and lagoon views</p><ul><li>Walking distance to nightlife</p><ul><li>Near shopping and restaurants</p><ul><li>Central to Hotel Zone</p><p><strong>Who Stays Here:</strong></p><ul><li>Hyatt loyalists (points!)</p><ul><li>Families wanting Hotel Zone access</p><ul><li>Dolphin enthusiasts</p><ul><li>First-time Cancún visitors</p><ul><li>Business travelers adding family time}

Accommodations

{<strong>Suite Categories:</strong></p><p><strong>Ziva Ocean View (from $450/night)</strong></p><ul><li>440 sq ft</p><ul><li>Ocean views</p><ul><li>King or two double beds</p><ul><li>Private balcony</p><ul><li>Good for couples or small families</p><p><strong>Ziva Ocean Front ($520-650)</strong></p><ul><li>440 sq ft</p><ul><li>Premium ocean position</p><ul><li>Better views</p><ul><li>Worth the upgrade</p><p><strong>Ziva Club Ocean Front ($650-800)</strong></p><ul><li>460 sq ft</p><ul><li>Club lounge access</p><ul><li>Enhanced amenities</p><ul><li>Priority services</p><p><strong>Family Suite ($700-900)</strong></p><ul><li>700+ sq ft</p><ul><li>Connected rooms option</p><ul><li>Configured for families</p><ul><li>Multiple beds</p><p><strong>Turquoize (Adults-Only Tower)</strong></p><ul><li>Adults-only within Ziva</p><ul><li>Own pool and beach section</p><ul><li>18+ only</p><ul><li>Higher tier experience</p><ul><li>$700-1,000/night</p><p><strong>All Suites Include:</strong></p><ul><li>Daily refreshed minibar</p><ul><li>24-hour room service</p><ul><li>Hyatt Grand Bed</p><ul><li>Smart TV</p><ul><li>WiFi</p><ul><li>Coffee maker}

World of Hyatt Integration

{<strong>Points Earning:</strong></p><p>Hyatt Ziva is a Category 7 property in World of Hyatt.</p><p><strong>Earning Points:</strong></p><ul><li>5 points per dollar (base members)</p><ul><li>Up to 10 points with status bonuses</p><ul><li>Points on all-inclusive rate</p><ul><li>Bonus promotions apply</p><p><strong>Redeeming Points:</strong></p><ul><li>Standard: 30,000 points/night</p><ul><li>Peak: 35,000 points/night</p><ul><li>Off-peak: 25,000 points/night</p><ul><li>Points + Cash options available</p><p><strong>Status Benefits at Ziva:</strong></p><ul><li>Discoverist: Base earning</p><ul><li>Explorist: Room upgrades when available</p><ul><li>Globalist: Suite upgrades, 4pm checkout, breakfast credit</p><p><strong>Points Strategy:</strong></p><ul><li>Transfer from Chase Ultimate Rewards (1:1)</p><ul><li>Book early for award availability</p><ul><li>Consider Points + Cash for flexibility</p><ul><li>Suite upgrades valuable for families</p><p><strong>Reality Check:</strong> Award availability can be limited at Ziva—book well ahead. Cash rates are often reasonable compared to points value.}

Dining

{<strong>Six Restaurants:</strong></p><p><strong>Chevy's Fresh Mex (Mexican)</strong> California-style Mexican in a fun atmosphere. Margaritas, fajitas, and Tex-Mex favorites. Kid-friendly.</p><ul><li>Dinner only</p><ul><li>Casual</p><p><strong>Tradewinds (Asian)</strong> Pan-Asian with teppanyaki and sushi. The teppanyaki show appeals to kids.</p><ul><li>Dinner only</p><ul><li>Reservations for teppanyaki</p><p><strong>Lorenzo's (Italian)</strong> Pastas and pizzas in traditional setting. Family-friendly menu and atmosphere.</p><ul><li>Dinner only</p><ul><li>Smart casual</p><p><strong>Moongate (International Fine Dining)</strong> The upscale option with sophisticated international menu. Adults appreciate this one.</p><ul><li>Dinner only</p><ul><li>Smart casual to elegant</p><ul><li>Reservations recommended</p><p><strong>El Mercado (Buffet)</strong> All-day buffet with multiple stations. Breakfast particularly good. Easy for families.</p><ul><li>Breakfast, lunch, dinner</p><ul><li>Casual</p><p><strong>Habaneros (Casual)</strong> Poolside and beachside casual dining. Tacos, burgers, quick bites.</p><ul><li>Lunch primarily</p><ul><li>Very casual</p><p><strong>Room Service:</strong> 24-hour with full menu options.}

Dolphin Discovery

{<strong>On-Property Dolphin Habitat:</strong></p><p>Dolphin Discovery operates a facility directly at Hyatt Ziva—one of the most convenient dolphin experiences in Cancún.</p><p><strong>Programs Available:</strong></p><p><strong>Dolphin Encounter ($140-180)</strong></p><ul><li>Entry level interaction</p><ul><li>Shallow water</p><ul><li>Petting and basic behaviors</p><ul><li>Photos included</p><ul><li>Ages 4+</p><p><strong>Dolphin Swim ($200-280)</strong></p><ul><li>Deep water swimming with dolphin</p><ul><li>Dorsal fin ride</p><ul><li>More active interaction</p><ul><li>Photos included</p><ul><li>Ages 6+</p><p><strong>Royal Swim ($280-350)</strong></p><ul><li>Most interactive program</p><ul><li>Belly ride, foot push</p><ul><li>Extended time</p><ul><li>Photos included</p><ul><li>Ages 8+</p><p><strong>Important Notes:</strong></p><ul><li>Programs cost extra (not included in AI)</p><ul><li>Book in advance (sells out)</p><ul><li>Ethical concerns exist (make own decision)</p><ul><li>Kids typically love it</p><ul><li>Guests get priority booking</p><p><strong>Location Advantage:</strong> No transportation needed—walk from your room to dolphins. This is Ziva's unique feature compared to other family resorts.}

Kids & Family Programs

{<strong>KidZ Club (Ages 4-12):</strong></p><p>Supervised kids' program with activities throughout the day.</p><p><strong>KidZ Club Includes:</strong></p><ul><li>Arts and crafts</p><ul><li>Water activities (supervised)</p><ul><li>Games and sports</p><ul><li>Movie time</p><ul><li>Cultural activities</p><ul><li>Treasure hunts</p><p><strong>Hours:</strong> Typically 9am-9pm <strong>Cost:</strong> Included in rate</p><p><strong>Teen Scene:</strong></p><ul><li>Ages 13-17</p><ul><li>Video games, movies</p><ul><li>Social activities</p><ul><li>Less structured than KidZ Club</p><p><strong>Family Activities:</strong></p><ul><li>Multiple pools (including kids' areas)</p><ul><li>Beach time</p><ul><li>Water sports</p><ul><li>Nightly entertainment</p><ul><li>Movie nights</p><ul><li>Beach games</p><p><strong>Family Pool Area:</strong></p><ul><li>Splash zone features</p><ul><li>Shallow areas</p><ul><li>Supervised at peak times</p><ul><li>Adjacent to KidZ Club}

Pools & Beach

{<strong>Five Pool Areas:</strong></p><p><strong>Main Infinity Pool</strong></p><ul><li>Stunning ocean views</p><ul><li>Swim-up bar</p><ul><li>Active atmosphere</p><ul><li>Full service</p><p><strong>Lagoon View Pool</strong></p><ul><li>Overlooks Nichupté Lagoon</p><ul><li>Quieter option</p><ul><li>Sunset views</p><p><strong>Family Pool</strong></p><ul><li>Kid-friendly features</p><ul><li>Shallow areas</p><ul><li>Near KidZ Club</p><ul><li>Splashing encouraged</p><p><strong>Adults-Only Pool</strong></p><ul><li>Quieter atmosphere</p><ul><li>No children</p><ul><li>For adults in main resort</p><p><strong>Turquoize Pool</strong></p><ul><li>Adults-only tower exclusive</p><ul><li>Most refined atmosphere</p><ul><li>Premium service</p><p><strong>The Beach:</strong></p><ul><li>Caribbean beachfront</p><ul><li>Calm, swimmable water</p><ul><li>Full service</p><ul><li>Water sports available</p><ul><li>Good for families</p><p><strong>Location Note:</strong> Punta Cancún has some of the calmest water in the Hotel Zone due to its protected position.}

Practical Information

{<strong>Getting There:</strong></p><ul><li>Cancún Airport (CUN): 20-25 minutes</p><ul><li>Transfer: ~$60 round trip or bookable through Hyatt</p><ul><li>Downtown Cancún: 15 minutes</p><ul><li>Ferry to Isla Mujeres: 10 minutes</p><p><strong>Hotel Zone Location Benefits:</strong></p><ul><li>Walk to clubs and restaurants</p><ul><li>Near Coco Bongo, La Isla shopping</p><ul><li>Easy taxi access</p><ul><li>Central to all Hotel Zone attractions</p><p><strong>What's Included:</strong></p><ul><li>All meals (6 restaurants)</p><ul><li>Drinks (including premium options)</p><ul><li>Room service 24/7</p><ul><li>Minibar daily refresh</p><ul><li>KidZ Club</p><ul><li>Non-motorized water sports</p><ul><li>Fitness center</p><ul><li>Entertainment</p><ul><li>WiFi</p><ul><li>Gratuities</p><p><strong>What Costs Extra:</strong></p><ul><li>Dolphin programs</p><ul><li>Spa treatments</p><ul><li>Excursions</p><ul><li>Premium wine bottles</p><ul><li>Golf (nearby courses)</p><ul><li>Motorized water sports</p><p><strong>Dress Codes:</strong></p><ul><li>Moongate: Smart casual</p><ul><li>Other restaurants: Resort casual</p><ul><li>No swimwear in restaurants}

Pros & Cons

{<strong>Why Choose Hyatt Ziva Cancún:</strong></p><p>✅ <strong>Pros:</strong></p><ul><li>World of Hyatt points (earn and redeem)</p><ul><li>Prime Hotel Zone location</p><ul><li>Dolphin Discovery on-site</p><ul><li>Good family programming</p><ul><li>Walkable to nightlife/shopping</p><ul><li>Multiple pool options</p><ul><li>Hyatt service standards</p><ul><li>Turquoize adults-only option</p><ul><li>Both ocean and lagoon views</p><ul><li>Calm beach water</p><p>❌ <strong>Cons:</strong></p><ul><li>Restaurants not exceptional (solid, not special)</p><ul><li>Large property can feel corporate</p><ul><li>Premium points redemption (30k+ nights)</p><ul><li>Dolphin programs cost extra</p><ul><li>Can feel crowded</p><ul><li>Not as intimate as boutique options</p><ul><li>Some rooms need refresh</p><ul><li>Hotel Zone = busier area</p><p><strong>Compared to Alternatives:</strong></p><ul><li>vs. Dreams: Similar quality; Hyatt has points, Dreams has better kids' program</p><ul><li>vs. Excellence: Excellence adults-only; Ziva for families with points</p><ul><li>vs. Moon Palace: Moon Palace is bigger; Ziva has better location</p><ul><li>vs. Zilara: Same property, Zilara is adults-only}

Booking Tips

{<strong>How to Book:</strong></p><p><strong>Points Booking:</strong></p><ul><li>Search Hyatt.com early</p><ul><li>Award space limited—book 3-6 months ahead</p><ul><li>Consider Points + Cash</p><ul><li>Transfer Chase UR if needed</p><p><strong>Cash Booking:</strong></p><ul><li>Compare: Hyatt.com vs. Costco vs. packages</p><ul><li>Often competitive cash rates</p><ul><li>Watch for Hyatt promotions</p><p><strong>Globalist Status Tips:</strong></p><ul><li>Suite upgrades valuable for families</p><ul><li>4pm checkout with kids = sanity</p><ul><li>Breakfast credit less useful (all-inclusive)</p><p><strong>Room Selection:</strong></p><ul><li>Ocean View: Good base</p><ul><li>Ocean Front: Worth upgrade for views</p><ul><li>Family Suite: If you need space</p><ul><li>Turquoize: If adults-only matters</p><p><strong>Maximizing the Stay:</strong></p><ul><li>Book dolphin programs in advance</p><ul><li>Register for KidZ Club day 1</p><ul><li>Explore Hotel Zone on foot</p><ul><li>Try all restaurants</p><ul><li>Use lagoon-side pool at sunset</p><p><strong>Best Value Timing:</strong></p><ul><li>May-June: Shoulder season</p><ul><li>September-October: Lowest rates</p><ul><li>Avoid: Spring Break, Christmas week}

Frequently Asked Questions

Is Hyatt Ziva worth the points redemption?

Depends on your points situation. At 30,000+ points/night, it's a decent value during expensive periods but not exceptional. If you have Chase UR earning cards and want an all-inclusive, it's one of the best options. Cash rates are often reasonable, so compare before redeeming.

How does Ziva compare to Zilara?

Same property, different sections. Zilara is adults-only with own pool, beach, and restaurants. Ziva is family-friendly. They share some facilities. Couples staying Zilara get away from children while still accessing Ziva restaurants. Families must stay Ziva.

Is the dolphin experience worth the extra cost?

For kids who love marine life, typically yes—the convenience of on-site access is valuable. It's expensive ($140-350 depending on program) and some travelers have ethical concerns about captive dolphins. Make your own decision, but kids who do it usually love it.

How is the food at Hyatt Ziva?

Solid but not exceptional. It's reliable Hyatt quality—nothing embarrassing, nothing memorable. Moongate is the best option for adults. Family-friendly restaurants do their job. Don't expect Grand Velas quality, but it's better than budget all-inclusives.

Is the Hotel Zone location good for families?

Mixed. Being able to walk to restaurants, shops, and activities is convenient. But you're also near nightclubs and party atmosphere. The resort itself is family-friendly; the surrounding area is Cancún's party central. Most families are fine, but it's not isolated resort peace.
